command: kubectl exec -n prod $(kubectl get pods -n prod -l app=myapp -o jsonpath='{.items[0].metadata.name}') -- bash -lc 'wipe -f /tmp/myapp/*.tmp'
explanation: Runs secure file wiping inside a Kubernetes pod for temporary files, targeting only the application’s temp artifacts.
rationale_steps: Resolve a pod name dynamically in the prod namespace using a label selector.
Execute bash in the pod and run wipe on only .tmp files within the app’s temp directory.
wipe overwrites data blocks before deletion to hinder data recovery from pod storage.
